data.name: Create a linked list class and its methods
data.description:
The linked list is a fundamental data structure in computer science, often used to help make other data structures. 

Create a linked list class, Node, and write methods to: 

    * Reverse a linked list (reverse)
    * Convert from an array to your linked list (from_a)
    * Convert to an array from your linked list (to_a: make 2 methods---a class method and instance method)

Create the linked list class from scratch. Do NOT use anyone else's library or prewritten data type for this list.

Test Examples (Ruby):

    Node.to_a(nil) #=> []
    Node.from_a([]) #=> nil
    Node.reverse(nil) #=> nil
    one = Node.new(1, nil)
    one #=> <Node @name=1, @next=nil>
    one.name #=> 1
    one.next #=> nil
    two = Node.new(2, one)
    two #=> <Node @name=2, @next=<Node @name=1 @next=nil>>
    Node.to_a(two) #=> [2, 1]
    Node.reverse(two) #=> <Node @name=1 @next=<Node @name=2 @next=nil>>
    range = Node.from_a(1..10)
    range.name #=> 1
    range.next.next.next.next.next.next.next.next.next.next.name #=> 10
    Node.from_a([3, 4]).to_a #=> [3, 4]
